data.title: Gabby Giffords’ Parents, Husband & Life After The Tragic Incident
data.meta_description: Gabby Gifford, wife of Senator Mark Kelly, was a politician before a tragedy changed her life. But she never let it slow her down. How has her life been lately?
data.text:
At 54, Gabby Giffords has earned the respect and admiration of people worldwide. The former Arizona congresswoman’s journey is one of incredible resilience and determination.

In 2011, Giffords’ life changed forever when she was shot in the head during a constituent meeting near Tucson. Despite the severity of her injuries, she fought back. Her recovery amazed doctors as she relearned to walk, speak, read, and write.

When Gabby returned to the House floor in August 2011, her colleagues greeted her with a standing ovation. It was a powerful moment that showed just how much she meant to those who knew her.

Since then, she has become a leading voice for gun control. She co-founded Americans for Responsible Solutions, a nonprofit organization dedicated to reducing gun violence, channeling her personal experience into a mission for change.

The honors keep coming for the former politician. In 2022, she received the Presidential Medal of Freedom, the nation’s highest civilian honor. She kicked off 2023 as the Grand Marshal of the Rose Parade, waving to crowds from a flower-covered float.

Even the U.S. Navy has recognized Gabby’s impact, naming a combat ship in her honor – the USS Gabrielle Giffords. It’s a homage to her fighting spirit and service to the country.

She continues to inspire the next generation of leaders. Each year, a promising woman in the local office receives the Gabrielle Giffords Rising Star Award, carrying on her legacy of public service.

When her name is mentioned at events, it’s not uncommon for the entire room to jump to their feet, chanting “Gabby! Gabby!” It’s clear that her courage and determination have touched many lives.

Brought Up In A Mixed-Religious Household

Gabby grew up in a home where different faiths blended. Her father, Spencer Giffords, was raised Jewish, while her mother, Gloria, was a Christian Scientist. This mix of traditions shaped her early years in Tucson, Arizona.

Her dad ran El Campo Tire, a family business started by his father, Akiba Hornstein. Interestingly, Hornstein had changed the family name to Giffords to avoid anti-Semitism after moving from New York to Arizona in 1940.

Gloria, nicknamed Jinx, brought her own artistic flair to the family. As a painter and art conservator, she worked to preserve Tucson’s Spanish art and missions.

The Giffords household was busy and diverse. Gabby has an older sister, Melissa, and a half-brother, Alejandro, from her father’s first marriage. Alejandro lived in Mexico City but spent his high school years with the family in Tucson.

Family time often meant road trips to Sonora, Mexico. These adventures were filled with hunting for art and books in small towns, giving young Gabby a taste for exploration and culture.

Spencer played an active role in the community, serving on the Tanque Verde school board. He took great pride in Gabby’s achievements and was deeply affected by the 2011 shooting that nearly took her life.

Despite his health challenges, Spencer made sure to be there for his daughter’s big moments. He was front and center when Gabby recited the Pledge of Allegiance at a Tucson event marking the anniversary of the shooting.

Sadly, her father passed away in October 2012. His loss was felt deeply by the family, but his influence on her life remains strong.

Gabby’s mother continues to be a big part of her life. Gloria’s ongoing support has been crucial in her journey of recovery and advocacy.

Inspired Husband, Senator Mark Kelly, To Run For The Office

Gabby and Senator Mark Kelly‘s love story is one for the books. They tied the knot on November 10, 2007, and have been each other’s biggest cheerleaders ever since.

Kelly, a former astronaut, made the leap into politics by winning a Senate seat in 2020. But he’s quick to credit Giffords as his inspiration. He wrote,

I couldn’t have run for office if I hadn’t had the example of your service and leadership to guide me.

Their bond is built on mutual admiration and a good dose of humor. Gabby gushes about her husband, calling him her best friend and praising his sense of humor. “He is so funny, funny, funny. I love him a lot,” she says.

Their first date was anything but ordinary. Giffords took Kelly to visit the Arizona state prison in Florence – a bold choice that set the tone for their unique partnership.

Mark’s support for his wife has been unwavering, especially since her 2011 shooting. He’s by her side at public events and frequently shares words of praise on social media.

Their relationship continues to evolve. Mark’s political career is on the rise, with buzz about him as a potential Vice Presidential pick. Through it all, the couple remains focused on each other and their shared goals.

Before Gabby, Mark was married to Amelia Victoria Babis for 15 years. But it’s clear that his partnership with the former congresswoman has pushed both of them to new heights, personally and professionally.

Together, the husband and wife have become a power couple in American politics, supporting each other’s ambitions and facing challenges side by side.

Maintains A Good Relationship With Stepchildren

Gabby’s family story shows how love and time can bring people together. When she first married Mark, his daughters Claudia and Claire weren’t exactly rolling out the red carpet.

The girls, from Kelly’s previous marriage, kept their distance at first. Giffords once shared on The Ellen DeGeneres Show,

We were never rude, we would just never give her the time of day or treat her like we would any other person.

But life has a way of changing things. The tragic shooting in 2011 brought the family closer. Today, Gabby enjoys a warm relationship with both her stepdaughters.

Claudia recently got married to Mark Sundman, and the activist was there to celebrate. The family joy doubled when Claudia and Mark welcomed a baby girl named Sage, making Gabby a step-grandmother.

Claire has made her mark in the business world. She’s been running Rise & Shine Social as its founder and CEO since March 2023.

Over the years, what started as a hesitant relationship has grown into a genuine family bond. Giffords has become an integral part of their lives, sharing in their joys and supporting their dreams.

Gabby Giffords Is Related To The Actress Gwyneth Paltrow

Gabby has an unexpected connection to Hollywood royalty. It turns out she’s related to Oscar-winning actress Gwyneth Paltrow.

The family link came to light in 2011 after she was shot during a public event. Paltrow’s rep confirmed the relationship to Entertainment Tonight, revealing that the two women are cousins.

Giffords’ grandmother and Paltrow’s grandfather were siblings. This makes Giffords’ father, Spencer, and Paltrow’s father, Bruce, first cousins.

So where does that leave Gabby and Gwyneth? They’re either first cousins once removed or second cousins, depending on how you count it. Either way, it’s a pretty close family tie.

Despite their family connection, Paltrow said in 2011 that she had never met the former congresswoman. Still, she expressed concern for her cousin after the shooting, saying her thoughts and prayers were with Giffords and the other victims.
